Understate: The claim may understate the importance of the Nigerian government's denial of the reopening of schools and the warning against unconfirmed news.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or direct quote from the Secretary to the Government of the Federation of Nigeria to back up the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the information from MySchoolNews.com.ng is accurate and reliable, despite the website later admitting that the press release it based the follow-up story on was "fake news."
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the claim is false and that no decision had been made to reopen schools, as stated by Nigerian education authorities.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that schools in Nigeria have been closed since March 2020, which is acknowledged by both the Nigerian government and the education ministry.
